studyProtocolVersions.officialTitle:
A Phase 3 Study of Nasal Glucagon (LY900018) Compared to Intramuscular Glucagon for Treatment of
Insulin-induced Hypoglycemia in Japanese Patients with Diabetes Mellitus

studyDesigns.name: Study Design 1
studyDesigns.description: The main design for the study

studyObjectives.description: The primary efficacy objective for this study is to evaluate the efficacy of TCZ compared with placebo in combination with SOC for the treatment of severe COVID-19 pneumonia

objectiveEndpoints.description: Clinical status assessed using a 7-category ordinal scale at Day 28

studyObjectives.description: The secondary efficacy objective for this study is to evaluate the efficacy of TCZ compared with placebo in combination with SOC for the treatment of severe COVID-19 pneumonia

objectiveEndpoints.description: Time to clinical improvement (TTCI) defined as a National Early Warning Score 2 (NEWS2) of <=2 maintained for 24 hours
Time to improvement of at least 2 categories relative to baseline on a 7-category ordinal scale of clinical status
Incidence of intensive care unit (ICU) stay

Time to clinical failure, defined as the time to death, mechanical ventilation, ICU admission, or withdrawal (whichever occurs first). For patients entering the study already in ICU or on mechanical ventilation, clinical failure is defined as a one-category worsening on the ordinal scale, withdrawal or death.
Time to hospital discharge or “ready for discharge” (as evidenced by normal body temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or <= 2L supplemental oxygen)

Time to recovery, defined as discharged or “ready for discharge” (as evidenced by normal body temperature and respiratory rate, and stable oxygen saturation on ambient air or <= 2L supplemental oxygen); OR, in a non-ICU hospital ward (or “ready for hospital ward”) not requiring supplemental oxygen

studyScheduleTimelines.name: Main Timeline
studyScheduleTimelines.description: This is the main timeline for the study design.

studyScheduleTimelines.name: Main Timeline
studyScheduleTimelines.description: This is the main timeline for the study design.

intercurrentEvents.name: termination
intercurrentEvents.intercurrentEventStrategy: Patients with out of range lab values before dosing will be excluded

activities.name: Discharge from CRU
activities.activityIsConditionalReason: At the discretion of the investigator

activities.name: Collect Pre-existing Conditions and Adverse Events
activities.description: Collect Pre-existing Conditions and Adverse Events

activities.name: Insulin infusion
activities.activityIsConditionalReason: Stopped once bedside PG is <60 mg/dL

activities.name: Study Treatment administration
activities.activityIsConditionalReason: 5 minutes after bedside PG reaches <60 mg/dL and insulin infusion is stopped.

activities.name: Clinical Lab Tests
activities.activityIsConditionalReason: At periods 1 and 2 pts should have fasted at least 8 hoours before any study procedures

activities.name: Ethanol testing
activities.activityIsConditionalReason: Only Females when needed to confirm postmenopausal status

study.studyRationale: Test of a cross over study
